question: How many Coulombs are required to oxidise 0.1 mole of <katex>$H_{2}O$</katex> to oxygen?
explanation: Reaction: <katex>$H_2O \rightarrow 2H^+ + \frac{1}{2}O_2 + 2e^-$</katex>. 2 Faradays are required per mole. For 0.1 mole, charge = <katex>$0.1 \times 2 \times 96500 = 19300 \ C = 1.93 \times 10^4 \ C$</katex>.
